t7

Class StatementHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • t7.StatementHandler

  • public class StatementHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class offers methods to handle executing statements (one at a time).
    Author:
    kinan

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatementHandler

        public StatementHandler(StatementInterpreter interpreter,
                        java.io.PrintStream resultStream)
        Creates a new Statement Handler.
        Parameters:
        interpreter - the interpreter that calls the appropriate method in the handler based on the parser.
        resultStream - the stream to print results through.

    • Method Detail

      • handleStatement

        public void handleStatement(Statement statement)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • instantiate

        private int instantiate(StructureTemplate template,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Expression> vars,
                        java.util.ArrayList<BooleanExpression> bools,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> names,
                        int index,
                        java.lang.String[] values)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Attempts to create instances recursively, each call will iterate on all possible values for the variables at index (that satisfy the relating boolean expression if provided).
        Parameters:
        template - the structure template to instantiate from.
        vars - the variables/values each relating to an index.
        bools - the boolean expression on each variable (null means no condition).
        names - the names of the indices.
        index - the current variable to iterate over values.
        values - keeps track of the current set of values assigned to every variable (will be used as a replacement in the structure template).
        Returns:
        the count of new instantiated structures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the type of some instantiation index was not an Integer or a Range.

      • getVariable

        public VariableType getVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the variable specified with the name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable.
        Returns:
        the variable with that name.
